plot: Arnie, a jeweller who retired early on health grounds, sells Del and his mates some gold chains but then says he wants them back for a previous customer. However he will ensure that he gets double the price to satisfy Del and his friends. As he is selling the chains to the other customer, Mr. Stavros, he collapses with a heart attack and is taken away, along with the money and the chains, by two ambulance men. However, it is a con. They are not real ambulance drivers but Arnie's sons, helping him relieve punters of their money. But then Cassandra hears that Arnie is going to sell the chains to Denzil. Cue Del and Co. to pose as ambulance men and wait for Arnie's next 'heart attack.'—don @ minifie-1

When Del attends a posh casino he meets smooth-taking Arnie - an entrepreneur and jeweller, who has taken early retirement on health grounds. Arnie persuades Del to buy a case of expensive gold chains from him, which he needs to let go due to tax reasons - and which Del can sell on at a huge profit. Del is happy to oblige, and later rallies his friends and family round to raise the money needed - and they all look set to cash in on the deal and make a big profit. Could Del really be going for gold - or will it be a case of 'all that glitters'...—stevecann2003
